senses.de: Being unsure, unclear or mixed up.
senses.ex: There was confusion about the meeting's time.

Tips.title: Situational Use
Tips.description: Used when events or information cause uncertainty in a specific situation.
Tips.example: The power outage added confusion to the crowded theater.

Tips.title: Common Misuse
Tips.description: Don't say 'confusion of' to refer to debates; 'confusion about' is correct.
Tips.example: There's a lot of confusion about the new schedule.

Tips.title: Emotional Impact
Tips.description: Can express frustration when plans go wrong or misunderstandings happen.
Tips.example: Her sudden departure caused confusion among us.

senses.de: A situation or condition where things are messy or not organized.
senses.ex: The room was in a state of confusion after the party.

Tips.title: Physical Misorder
Tips.description: Especially refers to a space that is cluttered to the point of being disorienting.
Tips.example: His desk was a confusion of papers and books.

Tips.title: Not Negative Always
Tips.description: Sometimes it's used humorously or affectionately about a minor mess.
Tips.example: The puppies left the room in adorable confusion.

senses.de: A feeling or condition where a person cannot think clearly or understand something.
senses.ex: The illness caused him to suffer periods of confusion.

Tips.title: Personal Experience
Tips.description: Highlights the personal, internal struggle to understand something.
Tips.example: He stared at the puzzle in confusion.

Tips.title: Temporary State
Tips.description: Implies that confusion is often a short-term reaction to a complex situation.
Tips.example: After waking up, she looked around in confusion.

senses.de: Mistake that comes from being confused.
senses.ex: A confusion between the twins led to the wrong one being blamed.

Tips.title: Error Source
Tips.description: Refers to a mistake specifically stemming from misunderstanding something or someone.
Tips.example: The confusion over names led to the wrong delivery.

Tips.title: Clarification Need
Tips.description: Signals a need for additional information or clarification to resolve the confusion.
Tips.example: To avoid confusion, please ask questions if you're uncertain.

Bafflement.wordDefinition:
Bafflement refers to a state of being completely puzzled or bewildered by something, and it is typically used when someone is faced with a situation that is completely unexpected or difficult to understand, while confusion refers to a state of being uncertain or unclear about something, and it tends to be used in situations where there are multiple possibilities or explanations, but none of them seem to fit perfectly.

Bafflement is used when something is perplexing or hard to make sense of, while confusion is used when there is a lack of clarity or understanding.

Chaos.wordDefinition:
Chaos refers to a state of complete disorder and confusion in which things seem to be happening randomly and without control.

Chaos usually describes a situation where everything is out of control and unpredictable.

An example of chaos would be a riot on the streets, where people are running around, breaking things, and causing chaos.

Disarray.wordDefinition:
Disarray refers to a state of disorder or chaos. It is when things are not in their proper place or functioning as they should.

For example, if you walk into a messy room where things are scattered all over the place, you might say that the room is in disarray.

Confusion is a feeling of uncertainty or lack of knowledge, while disarray is a state of disorder or chaos.

Disorder.wordDefinition:
Disorder means a lack of order or organization, characterized by chaos or a messy environment.

Both confusion and disorder can occur in various settings, such as in one's personal life, at school, or in the workplace.

Confusion is usually applicable when one is unsure about a particular situation, while disorder is applicable when there is an absence of order or organization in a particular space or situation.

Jumble.wordDefinition:
Jumble refers to a disorderly mixture or arrangement of things.

It describes a physical or visual mess, such as a jumble of clothes on the floor or a jumble of letters in a scrambled word puzzle.

Confusion relates to mental confusion or lack of clarity, while jumble relates to physical disorder or a mixture of things that are difficult to separate.

Muddle.wordDefinition:
Confusion and muddle both refer to a lack of clarity or understanding, but they can differ in their application.

Muddle often refers to a situation that is disorganized or chaotic. This could be caused by a lack of direction, unclear instructions, or a messy environment.

For example, a kitchen might be in a muddle if the ingredients are scattered around and there is no clear plan for cooking a meal.

Confusion refers to a mental state of uncertainty or disorientation while muddle refers to a physical state of disorder or chaos.

Perplexity.wordDefinition:
Perplexity refers to a state of confusion or uncertainty due to something that is difficult to understand. For example, if you are trying to solve a complex math problem, you might feel perplexed because you cannot figure out the solution.

Confusion is more a feeling of disorientation, while perplexity implies difficulty in understanding or solving a problem.

Turmoil.wordDefinition:
Turmoil refers to a state of great disturbance or upheaval. For example, when there is turmoil, there may be chaos, conflict, or unrest.

Confusion relates to a lack of understanding, while turmoil relates to a state of great disturbance. Confusion is applicable in situations where there is uncertainty or lack of clarity, while turmoil is applicable in situations where there is great upheaval or unrest.

quotes.Text: It's just my natural way - to be funny. I don't know why that is. But as I've said, humor is a quick cover for shock, horror, confusion. The critics hate funny writers for the most part. They think funny is not serious, but I think that funny can be even more serious than nonfunny. And it can be more affecting, too.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: T. C. Boyle

quotes.Text: I think 'Historian' is ultimately a positive record, but I was a little bit worried about taking people into a dark world. I tried to do it with as much care as possible, but it's not easy to ask people to think about death or loss or confusion.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Lucy Dacus

quotes.Text: I think that when you're writing fiction what you're doing is reflecting life as you see it, and putting down how you think and how other people think, and the sort of confusions that you don't normally like to admit to.
quotes.Title: British Author
quotes.Name: Helen Fielding

quotes.Text: Life is full of confusion. Confusion of love, passion, and romance. Confusion of family and friends. Confusion with life itself. What path we take, what turns we make. How we roll our dice.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Matthew Underwood

quotes.Text: Getting your house in order and reducing the confusion gives you more control over your life. Personal organization some how releases or frees you to operate more effectively.
quotes.Title: American Entertainer
quotes.Name: Larry King

quotes.Text: I personally have a background of many days on end of confusion, understimulation, overstimulation, and uncomfortableness with the world around me.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Mary Lynn Rajskub

quotes.Text: We grew up on hip-hop, metal, and hard core, which... reflect a certain amount of the chaos and confusion that are part of daily life.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Sonny Sandoval

quotes.Text: Very rarely is there any confusion as to when a painting or a song is finished. You just know when it's done.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Brandon Boyd

quotes.Text: For most of us, art is supposed to do something more than simply mirror the confusions of the world.
quotes.Title: American Critic
quotes.Name: Michiko Kakutani

quotes.Text: Eliminate the confusion in your life.
quotes.Name: Rudy Ruettiger
